intro: Stenogyne montana, commonly known as the mountain stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. This species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
